revised_title: The Scurvy-grass of Greenland: A Study on the Effects of Climate on Plant Properties
tldr: The author, David Nicolson, investigates the properties of the Greenland Scurvy-grass and its similarities to the common Scurvy-grass of England. He discovers that the plant's volatile salt changes its nature as it approaches the sun, becoming less pungent in the warmer climate of Greenland. Nicolson also notes that the plant's properties change when brought to London, suggesting that climate plays a significant role in the plant's characteristics.
